00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Main Octeon executive header file (This should be the second header
00044  * file included by an application).
00045  *
00046  * <hr>$Revision: 104981 $<hr>
00047 */
00048 #ifndef __CVMX_H__
00049 #define __CVMX_H__
00050 
00051 /* Control whether simple executive applications use 1-1 TLB mappings to access physical
00052 ** memory addresses.  This must be disabled to allow large programs that use more than
00053 ** the 0x10000000 - 0x20000000 virtual address range.
00054 */
00055 #ifndef CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING
00056 #define CVMX_ENABLE_PARAMETER_CHECKING 1
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 #ifndef CVMX_ENABLE_DEBUG_PRINTS
00060 # if !defined(__U_BOOT__)
00061 #  define CVMX_ENABLE_DEBUG_PRINTS 1
00062 # endif
00063 #endif
00064 
00065 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00066 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00067 extern "C" {
00068 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00069 #endif
00070 
00071 #include "cvmx-platform.h"
00072 #include "cvmx-access.h"
00073 #include "cvmx-address.h"
00074 #include "cvmx-asm.h"
00075 #include "cvmx-packet.h"
00076 #include "cvmx-warn.h"
00077 #include "cvmx-sysinfo.h"
00078 #include "octeon-model.h"
00079 #include "cvmx-csr.h"
00080 #include "cvmx-utils.h"
00081 #include "cvmx-clock.h"
00082 #include "octeon-feature.h"
00083 #include "cvmx-fpa.h"
00084 
00085 #if defined(__mips__) && !defined(CVMX_BUILD_FOR_LINUX_HOST)
00086 #include "cvmx-access-native.h"
00087 #endif
00088 
00089 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00090 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00091 }
00092 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00093 #endif
00094 
00095 #endif /*  __CVMX_H__  */
